intro: Podostachys sclerocalyx, commonly known as the hard-shelled waterwheel, is a unique aquatic plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its dense, floating mats of leaves that form a dense canopy on the water surface. The plant has small, scale-like leaves that are adapted to provide structural support and facilitate gas exchange in aquatic environments. Its reproductive structures, including flowers and fruits, are specialized for water dispersal. Podostachys sclerocalyx plays an important ecological role in stabilizing water bodies and supporting aquatic biodiversity.
